meanings.definition: Mix up in a confused or untidy way.
meanings.sent1: She always jumbles up her socks in the drawer.
meanings.sent2: Please don't jumbles the papers on my desk.
meanings.sent3: The cat jumbles the yarn into a messy pile.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts jumbles together like a tangled web.
meanings.sent5: The wind jumbles the leaves into a colorful whirlwind.

meanings.sent1: The closet was a jumbles of shoes and clothes.
meanings.sent2: The jumbles of wires under the desk made it hard to find the right one.
meanings.sent3: The jumbles of toys on the floor made it look like a fun obstacle course.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a jumbles of thoughts after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The jumbles of books on the shelf created a cozy, chaotic atmosphere.
